title: Hospitals in Israel and Gaza grapple with impact of war
description: With the war now in its second week, hospitals in Gaza and Israel are bracing for what is to come as so many patients have already poured in. Lester Holt takes a closer look at conditions at one hospital in Israel and another in Gaza.

title: Suzanne Somers, star of 'Three's Company,' dies at 76
description: Suzanne Somers is dead at 76, according to her longtime publicist R. Couri Hay.

title: Supplemental funding request for aid to Israel and Ukraine could come this week
description: Top lawmakers are preparing for a supplemental funding request from the White House for additional aid to Israel and Ukraine as soon as this week amid ongoing wars in both countries, two congressional aides and two administration officials told NBC News.

title: There's only one possible crossing out of Gaza now and it's still closed
description: Rafah, on Gaza's southern border with Egypt, is now the primary exit out of the strip as the two other border sites in Israel's control are closed.

title: Who is Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, dubbed ‘a dead man walking’ by Israel?
description: Israel’s military have called Yahya Sinwar a “dead man walking” and the hunt for Hamas’ leader in the enclave appears to be on.

title: Blinken calls on Israel to 'avoid harming civilians' but re-ups support
description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken spoke to reporters during his trip to Egypt and other Arab nations in an effort to prevent the Israel-Hamas war from expanding. Blinken reiterated that Israel has the right to defend itself against Hamas, but that it should take precautions against harming civilians.

title: Jake Sullivan defends saying Middle East region was ‘quieter’ days before Hamas attack
description: Eight days before Hamas launched its fatal attack on Israel, National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan had described the Middle East region as “quieter” than it had been in two decades. He defended those remarks on "Meet the Press" on Sunday.

title: Graham: I'm 'poised to use military force' to cut off Iranian funding for Hamas and Hezbollah
description: During an exclusive interview with Meet the Press, Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) addresses his comments about "holding Iran accountable" to avoid escalating the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Amid millions of open jobs, finding work remains a struggle with a criminal record
description: For nearly three years, Tonya Jones went on one job interview after another, only to be passed over for positions and have offers rescinded when background checks revealed a misdemeanor food stamp fraud conviction on her record.

title: ‘We’re not seeing any final preparations’ for Israeli ground invasion in Gaza on Sunday
description: NBC News Chief Foreign Correspondent Richard Engel reports from the Israel-Gaza border as many fear a ground invasion is “imminent.”

title: Sullivan: ‘We have not been able to get American citizens through the [Gaza] border crossing’
description: NSA Jake Sullivan says the US is working with allies and international organizations to get civilians to safety.

title: Couples online are sharing how an ‘invisible string’ tied them together before they ever met
description: People on TikTok are using audio of Taylor Swift's song to share their "invisible string theory" stories.

title: Sullivan says Biden admin. never took ‘its eye off the ball’ with Israel’s security challenges
description: Just eight days before Hamas attacked Israel, National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said the Middle East is quieter today than it’s “been in two decades.” During an interview with Meet the Press, he addresses his past comments.

title: Biden piles cash into DNC, state parties and his campaign in third quarter
description: Joe Biden’s campaign, the DNC and a fundraising organization powering Democratic state parties collectively raised more than $71 million in the third quarter.

title: Baseball backlash: Lesser teams are advancing in playoffs, and not everyone is happy
description: MLB championship trophies are about to be handed out to teams that didn't play like champions for six months — and hardcore traditionalists of America's pastime are not wild about that.

title: Fears rise as three Alabama hospitals prepare to stop delivering babies
description: Three Alabama hospitals will stop delivering babies, leaving two counties without birthing hospitals and a predominantly Black area of Birmingham without a maternity unit.

title: For people with sickle cell disease, ERs can mean life-threatening waits
description: A sickle cell health crisis can escalate into life-threatening complications, but patients still struggle to get seen quickly in emergency rooms and also to get pain medicine.

title: Schumer leads bipartisan group of senators to Israel while Gaza invasion looms
description: Majority Leader Chuck Schumer has landed in Tel Aviv to lead a congressional delegation to Israel amid the war following Hamas' terrorist attack.

title: Jeff Landry wins Louisiana governorship, flipping the state for Republicans
description: Democrats’ two-term hold on the governorship of Louisiana is over, after Republican state Attorney General Jeff Landry won the seat Saturday.

title: Ron DeSantis says U.S. shouldn't take in refugees from Gaza
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis said Saturday that the United States should not accept refugees from Gaza.

title: Mounting debt threatens Mike Pence’s campaign
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence’s 2024 campaign faces a potentially existential cash squeeze, with debt already piling up.

title: Suspect in custody after shooting at State Fair of Texas prompted evacuation
description: A suspect was in custody after gunfire erupted at the State Fair of Texas on Saturday night, Dallas police said.
